poem:
Title: "In Defence of Rebirth"

Complain, we do, at art's refrain,
Beyoncé's echo of Dolly's pain.
Yet reboots, remakes, renew
Not dilute, but hue anew.
A canvas white, a desert rain,
Where old, reframed, becomes arcane.
Jolene in falsetto sighs,
Her tale in fresh guise;
An echo's depth is not its shame,
The old in new, it's not the same.
